definition: to spread out/to open up/to exhibit/to put into effect/to postpone/to prolong/exhibition

sentences.english: Lengthening and broadening them does not mean tensing them.
sentences.chinese: 延長展寬並不意味着使雙腳緊張。

sentences.english: The nonlinear mechanism is the excitonic band broadening.
sentences.chinese: 非線性機制爲激子帶展寬。

sentences.english: In case of electronic scanning the beam width is broader by a factor of two .
sentences.chinese: 電子掃描時，波束寬度展寬一倍。

sentences.english: From the right and left side floating ribs to the armpit chest, feel yourself ascend.
sentences.chinese: 你的脊椎和胸部往上提，胸部向左右展寬。

sentences.english: With the surging of cars, the Municipal Government decided to broaden the original streets.
sentences.chinese: 由於車輛的增多，市政府決定把原有的街道展寬。

sentences.english: High-frequency S-wave envelope is broadened by medium inhomogeneity.
sentences.chinese: 介質非均勻性可引起高頻S波包絡的展寬。

sentences.english: And the high-order effects always broaden the ultima spectrum at different levels.
sentences.chinese: 高階效應均使最終頻譜得到了不同程度的展寬。

sentences.english: The effect of system distortion on range profile of wide-band radar is analyzed, and the compensation method is discussed too.
sentences.chinese: 系統失真將導致雷達距離像的展寬，併產生距離旁瓣。

sentences.english: With the ball milling time, the curve of diffraction apex became wider markedly.
sentences.chinese: 隨着球磨時間的增加，衍射峯譜線明顯展寬。

sentences.english: The inhomogeneity of magnetic field leads to broaden the region of vortex propagation.
sentences.chinese: 磁場的非均勻性將導致傳播區的展寬。
